channel.title: How do I make it so that you can't use certain items in the wilderness?
channel.description:
[center]In my PI server, I'm making a donator set that will be have excessively good bonuses, but to keep PKing fair and balanced I would like to add a method so you can't use the items in the server, I do not have the models yet so if you need to refer to an item ID, please use hashes (#).
My 'Is in wild' method is [code=java]if(inWild()) {[/code]
Would it be something like
[code=java]if(WearID = ####) && if(inWild()) {?[/code]
My base as states is Project Insanity.
I would like to make it so that if a person is wearing a single piece, or all of the donator clothing they cannot attack players in the Wild, and I would like it to send the message "You cannot use this item in the wilderness."
Any help? :)
[/center]

item.title: How do I make it so that you can't use certain items in the wilderness?
item.dc:creator: @The_Unholy The Unholy
item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

[center]In my PI server, I’m making a donator set that will be have excessively good bonuses, but to keep PKing fair and balanced I would like to add a method so you can’t use the items in the server, I do not have the models yet so if you need to refer to an item ID, please use hashes (#).

My ‘Is in wild’ method is

if(inWild()) {

Would it be something like

if(WearID = ####) && if(inWild()) {?

My base as states is Project Insanity.

I would like to make it so that if a person is wearing a single piece, or all of the donator clothing they cannot attack players in the Wild, and I would like it to send the message “You cannot use this item in the wilderness.”

Any help?

[/center]
